file_content.text: I've sent those plans you recovered to my superiors. Soon the Jedi won't have any secrets left.
I found these while I was clearing out the Jedi outpost.
This looks like part of the Jedi's defensive strategy for Voss! I'll get this to my superiors immediately.
Between these plans and annihilating their base, you've struck a real blow against the Jedi.
The Jedi won't be using their little outpost anymore.
We intercepted a distress call; I wondered if it might be your handiwork.
They'll be too busy trying to rebuild to interfere much with our truce with the Voss. Nice work.
I hate to think of it as work; taking care of the Jedi is fun.
I enjoyed that too much.
Fun? If you say so, but I'm glad you handled them instead of us.
Any responsible citizen could see the Jedi were a threat.
I did what had to be done.
They'll be less of a concern now, thanks to you.
My part in this is done.
With their communications disrupted, we should be able to handle anything the Jedi can organize. Thank you.
We've picked up some distress signals from the outpost I mentioned--I thought you might like to know there're still survivors up there.
I'm glad you're here, my lord, I've just received important news from our spies.
Sir, I've just received important intel from one of our advance recon teams.
Excuse me, I don't want to seem presumptuous, but I've got important intelligence that needs to be shared.
We've uncovered a hidden Jedi outpost in the cliffs not far from here; they don't know we've found them yet.
The Jedi must be dealt with, immediately.
Ready your men for an attack.
I'm sorry, I can't send troops out there. My commander has really tied my hands on this one.
This sort of information is vital to the Empire's plans; your commander needs to be informed.
Have you told your commander?
He's busy dealing with the Voss. I'm telling you because you might be able to do something.
Tell me you've dealt with it.
That's just it, I'm telling you about it because I can't deal with it.
We're not allowed to initiate an attack. The higher-ups say we can't breach the supposed peace.
I've been told it's important to keep the Voss happy, but this is a special circumstance--surely something can be done.
Leave it to me. The Jedi will regret ever coming to Voss, and the natives won't ever know.
I'll handle this quietly.
You're asking me to defy your superiors.
You want to break the peace?
This sounds like your problem.
I was hoping you'd be able to do what I can't. I said I'm not allowed to send troops to attack the base.
The Jedi think we won't risk the truce, my lord, but you could wipe them out without the Voss ever knowing. It's perfect.
Of course, a Sith of your skill and authority could handle the Jedi, and the Voss would never know about it.
Of course, as an independent operator, you're not technically bound by the truce. You could go after the Jedi yourself.
It'd be improper to suggest abandoning regulations, sir, but you've freedom enough to attack the Jedi yourself--the Voss'd never know.
That doesn't rule out an independent strike, however--you'd have the advantage of surprise; they'd be defenseless against you.
They think they're safe from the Empire. They're wrong.
Leave the Jedi to me.
The "peace" is amusing, but it shouldn't define our actions.
Treachery is my business.
Taking out their outpost should disrupt their activities for a while.
Makes sense tactically.
Hitting a hidden Jedi outpost sounds like my kind of fun.
You've got a deal.
I don't envy them having to face you in a closed space. They'll wish we'd never found them.
I'll do it if I find the time.
I understand. I'm just passing the information along to you.
Of course, if you find anything that hints at the Jedi's activities, Captain Mereel will want to see it.
When your commander decides what to do, you can take care of it.
Await orders. [Refuse quest]
I understand. I'll compile my report for Captain Mereel's return and hope the Jedi don't pull up stakes before he gets back.
These earthquakes are driving me crazy. I've swallowed enough dust to build Voss another moon.
With their outpost destroyed, the Jedi can't interfere with our negotiations with the Voss.
